newsitem.title: CHINA: China M2 expected 23 pct higher by end-June.
newsitem.headline: China M2 expected 23 pct higher by end-June.

text.p: China's broad M2 money supply is expected to increase by 23 percent in January-June this year, the Futures Herald said on Thursday.

China's M1, or currency in circulation plus current business deposits, was forecast to grow at about 17 percent at end-June, the newspaper said, quoting a report by the State Economic and Trade Commission. It gave no further details.
China's M2 grew by 25.3 percent in 1996 while M1 was up 18.9 percent, official figures show.
Earlier forecasts have put China's M2 growth at 24.5 percent for 1997 while M1 is seen rising by about 18 percent.
